title: 3 Fast Ways to Find the Model Number on Your HP Laptop

steps.title: Press the Fn+Esc keys on your HP laptop.
steps.content: Press the Fn + Esc keys on your HP laptop. This quick keyboard shortcut quickly opens the HP System Information window, which lists your model number, product number, and serial number.

steps.title: Look for a sticker on the bottom of your HP laptop.
steps.content: Look for a sticker on the bottom of your HP laptop. Most HP laptops have a product label on the bottom that contains the product number, serial number, and other helpful information. [1] X Research source In most cases, you shouldn't have to remove the battery to access the product label. However, if you don’t see a sticker on the bottom of your HP laptop and you have a removable battery, power down your laptop , open the battery compartment, and remove the battery to find the product label.

steps.title: Hold down ⊞ Win and press R.
steps.content: Hold down ⊞ Win and press R . This will open the "Run" command on any Windows PC.

steps.title: Type msinfo32 and click OK.
steps.content: Type msinfo32 and click OK . This opens the Windows System Information utility, which contains details about your specific model of laptop.

steps.title: Find the "System Model" section.
steps.content: Find the "System Model" section. Your HP laptop's model number appears next to "System Model" in the list. The System Information panel is also a great place to find detailed hardware information , including how much RAM is in your laptop.
